author: Lowno88
title: They had to call an ambulance for me
body:
Every time you phone it says no room in the queue.  
They won't book appointments if you walk down there and see them you have to phone.  
I feel they give incorrect information and they kept pushing back my appointment until I refused to leave and they had to call an ambulance for me.  
I had a huge infection but until they saw me I felt like it was irrelevant because I could swallow. I was also dangerously dehydrated

author: Disgr89
title: Individualised Care
body:
How on earth you can keep telling my elderly parents in their 80’s that they can’t make telephone appointments or call into the surgery but must use an app is absolutely disgraceful in any circumstance!  
They do not posses smart phones and don’t even have a tablet or computer, let alone have ever been on a website in their lives.  
They are constantly stressed about having to ask me to make appointments as well as the stress of being told that they have to go online.  
Look at your patient demographic Donneybrook Surgery and sort yourself out. Quality and individualised patient care is at the centre of patient care in the NHS, and I’m sure I could provide you with quite a few CQC quality standards.

author: orangebe36
title: Hastings Old Town Surgery
body:
I called the surgery in the morning. I was first in the queue (even though it took ages for them to answer!) and was told there would be no triage, just appts. Happy with this, I explained my issue. The receptionist took down details and offered an appt at another surgery. I explained that I couldn’t make that time, as I had another appt elsewhere, could I get an afternoon one. Was told basically no, the system doesn’t allow future appts for later in the day, it’s first come first served on the system, so I either take it or don’t see a doctor.  
Honestly, I think this kind of service is just horrific. In my view, this surgery is beyond incompetent now - they have no patient care anymore, the phone system is awful and long winded, you are lucky if you get a receptionist who will actually listen, and the triage system is a joke.  
In my opinion, the owner, shareholders & GPs at this surgery need to take a long hard look at the feedback they are receiving and do the right thing. Change the system and get back to actual patient care!

author: lovett69
title: The worst experience in maternity care
body:
Absolutely no consistency in this hospital. Told different rules every day. No visitors, to having 4 visitors, to having 3 visitors, to having time slots. No one is allowed to hold the baby apart from mum and dad, to visitors can hold baby, and back to no visitors allowed to hold baby. That was in the space of 5 minutes.  
No support to the mum and dad, didn’t care about the risk of postnatal depression - if anything, they were pushing her towards it, in my opinion! Mum was put on the ward without her baby (which was needed due to being premature), but hearing all of the other babies with their mums, it was very hard for her.  
Also being told there was a room for her, but they wouldn’t move her. It’s disgraceful, in my view. Definitely not needed as a first-time mum at all. Worst experience.

title: Absolutely shockingly useless
body:
Put 1 star as nt possible to put no stars!!! Absolutely sick to death of this place. Had nothing bt problems with them for 10yrs now!!!!! Absolutely useless!!!
Never listened to, things i tell them never written on care plans!! Have to chase them up to send it the drs as cant get new prescriptions! Never get through on phone which led to me being discharged last Dec. They just dont give a care to people or help! No consistency, never do reassessments, number of times they put denies suicidal tendencies when asked at times when not even asked me or ive told them feeling suicidal. Same questions how u ate, how u slept off u go. U wait 6-9mnths til ur next appointment only to be given 10 mins! The care has been non existent to me despite being on their books for past 10yrs!Like talking to brick wall!If ur nt able to make ur appointment then u go without for mnths on end!!! The things i could say & bad experiences iv had with this place would shock ppl to their core. Its disgusting!!! All yr ive been waiting for them to sort my referral bk gps have emailed twice. Access team have wrote to them after i was suicidal because i cant cope. That was August! Psychiatrist rang after i told them i want someone else&to start from the beginning. Was told would ve discussed&sorted that afternoon that was 2mnths ago & nothing! U ask for help, u cant get it even when ur under secondary mental health care. My partner even been up twice after nt getting thru on phone for 6mnths!He buzzed loads of times to be ignored. Even knocked on window was ignored when trying to get somones attention. Constantly been let down repeatedly. I got to the point where making my mental health worse cuz they cause so much more stress. 
Nothing is followed up, they dnt post ur care plans except if feel like it. My own drs surgery can't get in touch. They've 1receptionist answering the door, phone& everything else. Been telling them all this for yrs everytime. 10yrs later nothings changed!Psychiatrist who also works at parent&baby unit doesn't even know what meds i could have!
Does not give u any confidence when ur trusting these ppl with ur life!
Care is non existent! They dnt even bother to familiarise themselves with ur file for ur appointment.  How are u supposed to get anything out of 10mins?!!!to last u for nx 6-9mnths!!!!!!!!! The amount of times iv been in crisis over last 10yrs and had no help is unreal. Ur just left to cope even when uv had ur 1st baby and most at risk for postpartum psychosis!!!!! Im talking with actual real disorders u have for life like proper mental health illnesses nt just mental health issues!!!!! And still u cant get any support!!!!! Everything they do obviously isnt working bt change nothing to improve it! Lost any faith in them entirely&now feeling so lost, daunted&everyday doom of coping alone with it all&nowhere2turn. Struggling to cope everyday. I struggle so much every single day! done&do everything to help myself all bt i cant do it all by myself!

title: great support as always
body: I had what for me was a very urgent query about the possible reaction of medications.  I phoned in at about 5pm and by 6.30pm received a phone call that  sorted the problem completely.   I am ovrwhelmed that in these difficult times I am so lucky as to be with this practice.  Thank you Dr Kaufman, reception and all the kind and patient staff.

title: Dreadful appointments system- unacceptable
body:
From lengthy experience of this Surgery, the routine testing regime (blood tests, BP, etc) seems to be reasonably efficient.
However, the appointment system is appalling; recently the online booking system via the NHS App only offered phone/face-to-face appointments 9/16 days in advance. Attempts to make an appointment by phone from 8am involved a 90 minute wait, only to be told that all that the appointments had gone. I was then advised to repeat the entire process the following day with no greater chance of success, or to attend at Reception the following morning at 8am to request an appointment later that day.
Please see my Google review and the 120+ other online reviews with an overall disappointing 2* (out of 5) rating.

title: Somehow awful
body:
Unfortunately, I cannot help but express my increasingly disappointment at not being able to:
Book an appointment face to face
Not having follow ups of my issues so they become worse
Not having a response as for the reason why it is so complicated to see or even contact a doctor.
Also, a few months ago I left a review here because of rudeness at reception. I kindly observed an immediate feedback for me to send an email to explain the issue but this was never followed up by the manager.

title: Selective service
body: when I tried to register to go on doctors list I was told I am not in the catchment area but on the NHS website it can be possible to be out of area despite I am only living 1 mile away. The area is convenient for me as I attend the dental services. Is this service selective and biased.

title: Fantastic Service
body:
I was diagnosed with bowl cancer. Within 7 weeks of the initial diagnosis, I had met with the cancer team, had a mri and ct scan and now have had my operation all at the Royal Devon and Exeter Hospital.  This was in mid November 2022.

Initially I considered going private and met with a consultant at the Nuffield hospital. The consultant simply said don’t bother with private, no one will do better than the rd&e

How right he was. My consultant carried out my operation and managed to avoid giving me a stoma, something he knew would cause me great stress.

I was then transferred to the Lyne Ward.
I can’t say I enjoyed it, I don’t like being out of my comfort zone.

However, the staff couldn’t have been more supportive, nice and very professional. They have gone out of the way to accommodate my every request.

I'm not allowed to name them, I wish I could.  Everyone was kind, professional and concerned about my personal welfare.

My sincere thanks go to all the staff of the Lyne ward.

Even the tea man was smiling and helpful.

To summarise my treatment has been outstanding

I might add than I’ve just emailed the BBC complaining about their negative reporting of the NHS.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Not acceptable
body:
Today i visited the a and e department as I had severe pain in my right foot. I was already waiting for an x ray of my foot which was requested by my doctor earlier in the week . 

During the week the pain had become more severe and was waking me at night. I could not stand for any length of time and only limp  which was affecting my employment and daily routine. I had read that the problem I was experiencing  should be addressed to avoid further damage and possible permanent deformity. I therefore thought it was reasonable to attend a and e at Eastbourne.

I booked in an ipad and began waiting. The display informed patients that there was a seven hour wait to see a doctor. There were few seats with many patients standing waiting.

After a short wait I was called into triage and told that as i was under my gp there was nothing that they would do for me and I was to wait until the x ray appointment came through.

No matter how much I explained that the pain had worsened The nurse was adamant that I could not be seen and must ask my doctor for stronger pain killers.

The nurse told me that there was an aging population in the country and due to this, care was limited. I am of the aging population who has paid my contributions for forty five years. I resented this excuse.

My foot was not even examined due to the fact that I hadn't had an accident or trauma. Therefore the bone sticking out at the side of my foot and the bruise were never observed.

I explained that I believed that it was a stress fracture from long standing foot issues however his was totally dismissed.

When I do receive an x ray and  follow up with the m s k department and discover that perhaps further unnecessary injury has occurred or possible deformity I will consider making a formal complaint.

title: Dissatisfaction with doctors
body:
My daughter has been suffering from severe abdominal pains. On Sunday 27/11 she called 111 who advised we go to a&e at Frimley. We were sent home after a brief review. On Tuesday 30/11 when still in pain she again called 111 who again advised we go back to a&e. I must add the nurses on both these visits were fantastic. 
On the second visit my daughter was admitted. She was on strong medication including morphine. My daughter had numerous tests and an ultrasound. The pain never stopped but as they couldn’t find anything wrong they discharged her even though she is in more pain than when she arrived. I find it completely unacceptable and just want to vent

author: rainng38
title: The process was very efficient
body: Visited the NHS Fife Covid vaccination service in Dunfermline. I received vaccinations for Flu and Covid from Ailsa. The process was very efficient and I must commend Ailsa for her professional and friendly manner. My thanks for a job well done.

author: LauraP62
title: Midwife care
body: I received excellent care with my newborn baby from Diane. Her genuine approach and knowledge was fantastic to reassure me that I was managing life with a newborn baby well. She was so kind,caring and definitely went above and beyond to ensure I was content and that me and my baby were doing well.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: columbamq36
title: I was made to feel so welcome
body: I had recently been in Ballochmyle suite for a procedure and transferred to the discharge lounge.  I was made to feel so welcome and the service that they provided was second to none.  The lounge was clean and welcoming and the staff were attentive and provided a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere.  I spoke with Senior Charge nurse Keenan and commended him on his department.  I felt like I was in a hotel lounge rather than a hospital lounge and felt so at ease and relaxed.  5star service.

author: Devon cancer patient
title: As soon as I met the team I felt confident
body: I had a surgery for breast cancer at the RD&E in October. As soon as I met the breast surgery team I felt confident that I was in capable hands. The plan of care was explained clearly and my tests were carried out quickly and efficiently.  The operation was booked in reasonable time and it was a relief to get it over with no hold ups. Everyone I met was kind and professional - the fantastic surgeon( Miss Ives), the nurses, and the radiologist.  After 6 weeks I am fully recovered with barely any sign of the surgery. I still have radiotherapy to look forward to but I am very grateful to all who have helped me so far. You are saving lives like mine everyday!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Aladm69
title: The van team have been great
body:
Without the van, I would not have had treatment for Hepatitis C and I may not be here today.  
The Van team have been great - they have regularly come to the area where I live which is isolated and they have never given up on me. Without them taking the time to come to me and work with me, I would not have got treatment. The other day they came over and did a test to see if my treatment has worked. The test came back negative which means that so far, my treatment has worked. The continued support and advice the van team have given me means that I now understand Hepatitis C a lot better and am able to make decisions and access services that will help me to avoid getting infected again.I can't thank you all enough.

author: scoreboardef55
title: Service process work very well
body:
I had a large cyst on my back - about the size of a golf ball. I visited my G.P. and was prescribed antibiotics. These did not work. My G.P give me a telephone number (Phone first) 0300123311 to ring to assess my issue. I rang the number and got a response very quickly. I was referred on the same day to a local hospital and had the lump removed. The service I received was both prompt and excellent.  
Once I left hospital I visited my local GP with a letter from the hospital.  
My local G.P arranged for a district nurse to visit me at weekends to change dressings and midweek I attended my local clinic. The service process worked very well and all NHS staff provided a friendly and efficient service. Thankyou.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: LauraET
title: Assistance centre
body: I am a sponsor for someone from Ukraine and we attended the assistance centre this morning. The health area was really helpful. They had a translator which was great to help the person get set up. Very friendly, welcoming and informative.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Phil22
title: Smiling nurses
body:
I was greeted at Cannock chase hospital at 7am by a bunch of smiling nurses and I was introduced to the nurse that had got to put up with me and my comedic approach.  
From Meeting Becky it’s was a great experience and from start to finish all but 6hrs of it I was looked after impeccably nothing was to much trouble and again when I arrived back at the ward after my small surgery Becky J was there waiting for me and explained everything that had happened and what they expected over the next couple of hours I was immediately given a hot drink and some biscuits and given time to get my bearings back.  
The visit was fantastic and made more relaxing by the nature of the nurses.

author: Riverman
title: Excellent experience in the endoscopy department
body: I want to give a big shout-out to the staff in the Scarborough Hospital Endoscopy Department for making my attendance for a sigmoidoscopy procedure much less unpleasant than I had anticipated. I was treated with kindness, good humour, and efficiency. The service was exemplary.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Brie33
title: Entrance door noise
body:
Ward 66 assessment bay .  
The entrance door across from bay 6 is so noisy when it closes it disturbs patients resting or sleeping during the night .

author: tigercz47
title: SPA mistreatment
body: Terrible. Been fighting for access to the right mental health support, and denied at every stages, long wait lists of months/years, sometimes get paired with a therapist not matched to you so therapy breaks down quickly and you have to go back on waiting lists. Even when in crisis unless you are going to actually do something to yourself, feels like they don’t care.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very thorough
body: GP very helpful. Got an appointment within a few days. Thorough investigations into my symptoms. Felt listened to, treated with kindness and respect. Thank you for a top class service.

title: A real display of human kindness
body: I recently spent the early hours of a busy Saturday night in the Fit Stop within A & E in Northampton General Hospital with a family member who had been admitted. From the first call from the department the staff were friendly, informative and reassuring. Being within the department I witnessed the best of human nature. Staff were kind, caring, non-judgemental and compassionate to absolutely everyone who came into their care. Watching and listening to them work was touching. Each and every one of them is an absolute credit to the hospital sand the NHS.

author: scoreboardzk53
title: So calming and caring
body:
I took a non epileptic seizure whilst at a concert in the o2 arena, and came round feeling very dazed and confused. Most of the first aiders at the arena took great care of me, however due to the nature of what happened an ambulance was called. Up on arrival to the scene, Nick and Will from EMFS ambulance service introduced themselves and made me feel so at ease. When in the ambulance Will was making jokes to take my mind off the situation whilst doing his best to assess me. Due to past history of anxiety whilst in ambulances, Nick and Will were so calming and caring that I wasn’t too focused on the anxiety I was filing.  
They are a great asset to the team and the London Ambulance Service are very lucky to have them

title: very good
body: from walking in to leaving I felt safe and reassured that my problem would be sorted out. Very pleasant efficient staff who deserve a lot more than just a thank you. Thank you so much for your care.

title: Great practice
body: Warm welcome waiting time was very minimum and service from Doctor and nurse was very good  the Doctor explained things clearly  about the procedure thanks

title: Fantastic service
body: Visit to a&e late evening. Although they were busy it was very efficient and quick. All staff were so helpful and friendly.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Greeted courteously by the receptionist with an explanation of expected waiting time. However I was seen even more quickly by a very friendly nurse who assessed and decided on treatment involving glueing a cut above my eye which was carried out immediately with advice given. The cut is healing brilliantly. Thank you for a reassuring experience. I was contacted by text for a review but was reluctant as the link given in the text was not secure. Otherwise, full marks!

title: Great improvement
body: Have been patient at grange for many many years and experienced when it was one of the best in the area  the last few years the practice not on its own along with most others in  Huddersfield but I am pleased to say on my experience they have improved greatly answer the phone very quickly also reception very friendly and getting to see doctor much better so I am pleased to say great improvement hope this remains

title: Good practice
body: All staff are caring and professional. I get to see my own gp everytime i book an appointment and the e consult makes it very easy to get the correct help when needed from the comfort of my own home. Would definitely recommend

title: A Safe practice
body: I recently had a worry regarding an allergy about which I spoke to a receptionist. I was immediately given a date for a telephone consultation with my doctor who discussed my concerns. I am very happy to be a patient with this practice .

author: Pilot Bob
title: Looked after very well
body:
I was admitted to ED after a very reassuring experience with 2 air ambulance paramedics who attended to me at the airport hotel. Taken by ambulance to ARH where I spent around 1.5 hrs waiting in the ambulance, being looked after very well. Admitted to A&E where I was cared for very well; being checked on and informed of test results and future tests requires. After about 9 hrs passed to ED department who cared for me, for until being transferred to a ward.  
I wish to highlight the Consultant Doctor, Bianca, who kept me informed of how things were going, what possible future options were being considered and what she would recommend (if it was one of her family).  
Staff Nurse Steph who lead her team with efficiency and empathy, not only for me but all the other patients that passed through her department (I was with then for around 10 hours); she ensured I knew how my progression was going.  
HCSN Ellie and Student Nurse Megan, though always busy caring for the patients in the department ensured I felt an individual.they not only checked thatI was feeling well, did not require anything, but also when they had a spare second would tidy up; re secured privacy curtains that had undone etc. they conducted themselves with humour, empathy and professionalism, sometimes in very difficult situations (as when being struck by an old woman they were helping); they kept calm and tried to reassure the patients while continuing to treat her.  
Once on the ward the high standard of care continued, especially Doctor Rabiyya who listened to my questions, managed and explained my release.  
What a well run team of professional individuals, who made what could have been a very long and fearful time into a more positive experience. Thank you.

title: Great service
body:
Every time I’ve called the receptionist are extremely helpful and friendly.
They always explain exactly what there doing for you and what the next contact will be.

title: Quick & efficient
body: Was very impressed with my first visit to Glenlea surgery. Was greeted at the door and pointed in the right direction. No wait. Nurse was extremely friendly. Very impressed

title: Great practice and doctors
body: Every time I have needed to see the doctors have managed to find a doctor that understands me. Communication is perfect and have never had any problems with the practice

title: I am very grateful for the very good service I…
body: I cannot fault the service I received from my GP. She was thorough, compassionate and efficient. Within 24 hours of my online consult request I received a reply and was seen the same day. An appropriate referral was made and I had the necessary scans (which I am happy to say were ok) within 2 working days. The doctor followed up my appointment with a telephone call to discuss my results. I was initially apprehensive about online consult, but it is quite straightforward once you do it and it worked for me, Thank you very much for helping me when I needed it. I was treated with care and respect.

title: Great service as always
body: I had an econsult reply by telephone.  My GP was polite and courteous as always.  Listening to what my call was about and made me feel at ease when discussing the reason I had been in contact with the surgery about.  I would be more than happy using this surgery and it’s GP, all of those I ever deal show me respect and dignity.

title: Breast care
body: Nurse and Gp’s communicated and responded appropriately to my concerns. I was prescribed treatment in a timely manner and treated with care.

title: Lovely receptionists
body: First thing on a Monday morning isn't usually the best time to visit a GP practice with a query, but the 2 receptionists at New Wokingham Road Surgery this morning couldn't have been more helpful! Come to think of it, every time I've needed this GP practice the receptionists have been great. So thank you ladies for all that you do for the local community. Best wishes xx

title: Excellent experience
body:
Filled out an e-consult and had a phone call 3 days later. Offered appointment same morning. Saw a lovely medical student who was extremely thorough and spent a lot of time asking about my medical history. I was then seen by a GP and referred to hospital.
I know the e consult system isn’t always good for some conditions and at times it’s frustrating, but on this occasion, I couldn’t have asked for better or more efficient care.

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I act for my brother the practice is always kind and caring they are Marvelous so quick to respond. Thank you

title: Super healthcare service
body: Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Reception are most helpful and endeavour to assist with all queries whether it be medication or GP consultations or appointments.Doctors feedback is timely and informative. Overall professional feel to the service provision. Having experienced very poor service in the past from another practice it is a pleasure to  be registered with Prescot Medical centre who in my opinion are second to none.

title: Excellent service
body:
The Hospital is a lovely building, very clean and well organized re planning of various clinical rooms.
I found all the staff very friendly and helpful and gave me confidence that I was in safe hands. I mean all staff, including the young man who gave me coffee and biscuits after my surgery. Thankyou to everyone.

title: Excellent service
body:
Saw doctor with my bad ear infection, 
He examined and then referred me to ENT for treatment, now on the way back to normality.

author: pictorfk83
title: "Distressed about the care he experienced"
body:
I would like to say at the start that there were nurses running all over the place trying to attend to patients, so they were clearly very busy and understaffed.  
I took my husband who is registered blind into A&E with high blood pressure, shortness of breath, coughing in pain and understandably anxious  
He is also hard of hearing.  
When we told the people at desk and triage about the hearing and being blind they were fine with this and I went in with him.  
However, when we went in for bloods, we were told abruptly that there was only one person allowed in and the door was closed on me. The nurse got better but there just seemed no system throughout for flagging up his needs.  
It all went on into the evening with us waiting and after 6 hours there were more bloods and chest X rays but no results  
The doctor came in finally after 7 hours - we were in blood room to wait because there was nowhere else by that time. They were splayed out in chair and apologized saying sorry but they were so tired - long shift after a long shift. We were surprised at this behaviour. They then said -so you are blind and asked my husband to guess what colour he was. My husband was taken aback and made a guess. They then went on to say that my husband needed a nebulizer and more meds so needed to stay in to see med team in the morning and have a ct scan.  
He was then left on a trolley to sleep on in a corridor and next to cupboard with no covering. The only loo was at far end of corridor, and he did need the toilet several times in the night which of course was very challenging for him.  
I had left as it was half midnight but my husband could not easily get to toilet. He can see some vague shapes so pushed button to go back in reception went past there to the loos and had to be let back in. The receptionist got bolshy second time around which was very demeaning for my husband. Next time he had to explain that he couldn't see which was very demeaning again no information passed on about him. He had a covid test at 4:30 and then some steroids which made him start to hallucinate. Despite calling for nurses who would occasionally come to him say they would do something and then not return. No attention from staff then till 9:00 the next morning.  
The next morning, he had more steroids which sent him over edge. They made his blindness worse, and he could not bear the bright lights and was hallucinating.  
When the day shift started my husband was by this time very distressed with the overall lack of care and the medication given him and begged me to take him home and told a nurse.  
The nurse told another doctor who asked him to sign discharge form. He asked the doctor who had an accent he could not understand, what he wanted him to say. The doctor then got him to sign the form but had to keep saying bit higher as he got him to sign in the right place.  
I then found him at the edge of car park. He was complaining of flashing lights, he was cold and in a right state.  
We are very distressed about the care he experienced and being let out of the hospital like that. There seemed no system for communicating his needs.  
The Dr suggested that he would be fine sleeping on trolley because he was hard of hearing and blind which was really inappropriate and insensitive.  
Even after all this there have been no notes sent to our own doctor. Other examples of care included sputum samples that were never looked at and the nurse could not find the phials of medicine to go into the nebulizer. There was no attention paid to the hallucinations caused by the steroids. He was never written up for CT scan which he was told he needed.  
We would really like the hospital to be aware of this distressing experience so have shared our feedback. My husband has given consent for this to be shared.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: A good practice
body: Turned up for my flu jab on a Saturday morning. Was called in straight away. Surgery was clean and presentable, lots of staff about and was running smoothly. Separate exit once my appointment was finished. A good experience

title: good experience
body: from start to the result it was a good experience, reception staff friendly and helpful, physiotherapy injections on my thumb was very effective and the exceptional Physio was kind gentle and very professional, I have private health care but this service was best it gets and I would have no hesitation recommending this practice.

title: Well staffed fully equipped local practice
body: In the current state of the struggling NHS service this practice is still providing a solid and well rounded service to its patients

title: Very neat, nice little practice
body: I was in for a wait but the doctor was so thorough with all of my problems that I can understand why. Nothing resolvable but we talked it over. Very good doctor.

author: Vanrg56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Professional, kind and patient
body: The members of the team: Hugo, James, Ciara, Michelle, Alison, Donna and Sasha (I may have forgotten someone- apologies) were very professional, kind, patient and though I was very ill the first three days, I felt I was in safe hands. In spite of staff shortages and limited time, I never felt they were in a rush, James even fed my budgies and Donna on her way home took the time to sit and have a chat and saw me safely to bed. The biggest thank you and God bless

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: exceptionally excellent
body:
the practice response to my family's needs have
been outstanding over many years , exceptionally 
recently during the covid emergency. 
from the initial connection with the receptionists who
are always welcoming and good natured, helpful and 
listening to details of enquiries, to meeting the doctors, each
one, and I have been like an hypochondriac lately,  has welcomed me with a smile and given the time necessary to meet my medical needs.   Over and above expectation.

title: Attentive & excellent care throughout
body: I received the most attentive, supportive and excellent care throughout my pregnancy, labour, birth and post birth. All teams have been professional, supportive and treated me with respect and dignity. all decisions made were done so in discussion with myself. During labour and birth I was so well looked after, during the most vulnerable time, staff were nurturing, understanding and experienced, ensuring myself and baby were safe throughout. I would highly recommend Watford maternity services. I have been so well looked after these 9 months and continue to be since giving birth, physically and mentally. Thank you to everyone.

author: airyx87
title: Maternity services
body:
Overall, I had a positive experience in the maternity unit. My community midwife was first-rate; supportive and positive about my home birth and determined to help me realise my birth wishes. Sadly she was not on call when i went into labour, so i didnt know the community midwives who attended my birth. They were nice ladies but as i hadnt met them, i was very glad to have my doula with me to ensure my birth plan wishes where followed.  
The biggest problem with the service was that the midwives on call during the night (when most births happen) had been on shift all day, so when my birth was expected to last till 9/10am, they became increasingly unable to stay to facilitate a home birth. Consequently, i felt slightly pressured into transferring to hospital in the early hours.  
When i arrived at hospital, again i was eternally grateful for my doula interceding on my behalf. Despite my birth progressing better, the hospital maternity team were pressuring for interventions to speed things up. I agreed to continuous monitoring for a short period of time to ensure that all was well and despite there being no cause for concern, some staff were then reluctant to allow me to stop the monitoring and actively tried to go against my wishes and not let me use the birth pool when it became available. Without my partner and doula fighting on my behalf, i felt some staff would have been happy to refuse my requests when there was no good reason to do so, and were too quick to insist on interventions that were not necessary.  
I was also disappointed to find that there were no birthing balls, or floor mats available to use in the delivery suite and i was expected to remain on a bed during labour.  
With my partner and doula interceding on my behalf, senior staff reluctantly let me use the birth pool and allowed my birth to progress at its own pace and as a result i enjoyed a natural delivery with gas and air and no other interventions.  
The midwife who attended my birth in the hospital was also first-rate, she was supportive and calm, and had a level of trust in my capacity to have a natural birth that other staff lacked. I felt she was on my side, and supported me to make informed decisions about my care. As did the senior consultant who carried out my last scan.  
There was a total mix in the attitude of the consultants and other hospital staff during my pregnancy and birth. Some were wonderful, supportive and left me feeling empowered and supported in my care decisions. And others left me feeling overridden and disempowered, including. Examples of phrases that I feel should be avoided are things like "we won't let you..." "we don't let ..." "you can't ... " and references to things being "policy".  
That said, i would like to thank the majority of those involved with my care for their support and dedication through my pregnancy and birth. Your care and consideration was very much appreciated and made my overall experience a positive one.  
It would be great if funds could be found to make large birthing balls and floor mats available in the labour suite to facilitate more natural birthing positions and give expectant mums more freedom of movement during labour.  
It is also unrealisitic to expect midwifes to support home births when on shift during the day and then on call overnight.

title: Organised and Really helpful Gp Surgery
body:
Organised reception team and really polite receptionist  always there to support me with appointments and my quires.
Gps are always nice and supportive

title: Excellent practice
body: All staff are committed to help you with any issues. Doctors listen and are always professional and helpful. Easy to get female Doctors when needed. Thank you Kingsbridge.

title: Great Practice
body:
Easy appointment system, caring, hard working administrative staff, understanding and informative GP provided answers and explanations in a calm, reassuring and respectful way.
A very positive experience in true NHS fashion. I am grateful to them all for being there when needed. Well done Kingsbridge.  Thank you.

author: capellawc59
title: Botox injections on bladder.
body:
I got Botox injections into the wall of my bladder to help with my ongoing incontinence.  
I was very pleased with the clinic. Saba was the doctor who performed the procedure. She chatted with me prior to the procedure about what to expect. She introduced Rebecca who was a student studying to be a doctor. She was very pleasant and observed Saba then she took over and followed Saba's instructions carefully.  
The procedure was quick painless and I was well looked after by the team. This is a much needed service for people like me who have suffered severe incontinence for years in relation to an overactive bladder. It's awful living with the condition and the impact it has on my life and I rely on the hope of a period of relief given as a result of the Botox. I have been getting them for 15 years. Please continue this vital service to help those living with overactive bladder and or incontinence. It's an excellent service. Please continue to provide it. It gives me relief that's much needed. Many thanks.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Marvin31
title: 6 weeks radio therapy treatment
body:
Beginning 6 weeks of combined Radiotherapy and Chemotherapy was more than daunting. From the start however, I have to say, the entire team from reception to radiographers, support nurses and pharmacists made the experience very much easier. I never had any delay re treatment and was often seen early, which, when you are already going through such a traumatic time goes a long way to minimize stress. There is also great communication between the departments with no delay after treatment to have bloods taken or collect tablets. The service really has been exceptional.  
The car park is an issue at times with people under great stress, attending either A and E or the Cancer care unit often clashing due to limited and small spaces. Maybe clearer no entry signs would be beneficial as many people enter the wrong way when there may be people already waiting at the correct entrance.

title: Efficient service
body: Requested appointment online and was seen swiftly, follow up text and phone call after. Great service.

title: Right care at the right time
body: Managed to get an urgent gp to see unwell child within a short time of speaking to receptionist. This saved a long wait for nhs 111 or out of hours . Saw us at the end of the day. Very friendly receptionist and compassionate gp

title: Speedy Service
body: Thank you for responding to an online request for medication for an eczema flare up for a family member. Such a fast response- same day. Thanks to all involved in making this possible.

title: Impressed
body: Really impressed. Filled in the online request - was surprised to get a call back 10 minutes later and seen within the hour. Doctor (shame we can’t leave names) could not have been nicer; thorough, professional and very lovely with my little boy. Even phoned back later to talk through a treatment plan and text through a link to extra advice. Received a text an hour later to say prescription was waiting for us. Excellent service and made having a poorly child so much less stressful.

title: Excellent quick service
body: My son started with ear pain the morning of June 6th. I contacted the surgery via the website and within half an hour had a text reply with a face to face appointment approx 2 hours later . Within 3 hours of intial contact we had seen a Dr , obtained a prescription and were back home . Wonderful speedy , professional service .

title: Very good service today
body:
Today I saw Dr Fox-male and was very pleased with my visit, I find both the Rawdon and yeadon surgery's extremely helpful and I receive excellent service from both practices.
Thank you

author: Mr Bullock
title: Treatment for a head wound
body: A week ago I got a kick by a bullock to my head. My wife took me to A&E at Altnagelvin as I held kitchen roll to my head. On arrival I checked in and within a few minutes waiting I was called into triage. All beds were busy but doctor said as soon as he could get a trolley I would be called. I waited no more than 10 minutes and was then rolled to the scanner for head and neck scan. Back to A&E and six staples applied without freezing. I was fine with that as they were able to gain a cubicle quickly again though a few of staples were really sore. All the way through all the medical team were wonderful. My case was simple enough to deal with but it was also best suited to A&E. It is just a pity that other medical cases who have to attend A&E cannot get help from their GPs

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LuckyOldMan
title: Rehab following spinal cord injury and surgery
body:
After a fall down stairs at home, I ended up in A&E and two other hospitals before inpatient rehab at NRC, as a spinal injury unit was unavailable for several months.  
NRC was a dream come true following the other hospitals in London, which were understaffed and not at the same level of organisational standards, technical medical skill or nursing ability in SCI, care and kindness. Prior to NRC, I doubted I would walk again and thought it was all over for me. After my treatment at NRC, I walked out which was all I wanted.

author: Shellybabe134
title: The staff were amazing
body:
I can’t not thank the staff enough after my sons recent stay.  
He is 4 years old with severe autism, he had no understanding of what was happening and is non verbal so unable to communicate his needs to them.  
The staff were amazing with him, explaining and talking to him throughout any procedure even though he didn’t understand they still treated him as if he did. They were so caring, warm and compassionate, it certainly put me at ease during a very stressful time.

author: piscesmf89
title: Did not receive my autism diagnosis
body:
Adult Autism Team at Eastwood Care Centre, Clarkston.  
It took me ten months to see two autism professionals. I was sent there for an ASD diagnosis, undertook two appointments where I feel I was treated appallingly. They were given a mountain of evidence in regard to my ASD, and this was given on many occasions.  
But instead of doing my diagnosis, I felt as though they instead abused me, degraded me, and insulted me about things that were nothing to do with my autism assessment process.  
They then closed my case for no reason. In my opinion, they did not do their jobs and did not complete my diagnosis.  
In my view, this situation is an absolute disgrace. I was entitled to get a full diagnosis, like any other patient, and I feel they have not performed the duties of their jobs.  
Despite many letters, telephone calls and emails asking for my case to be completed, I have not received any response. They refuse to finish my autism diagnosis.  
Any patient is entitled and should have the ASD diagnosis completed to the end. I didn’t get that. I feel like they held personal grudges against me and closed my case so they could get rid of me.  
That is totally unacceptable. I am even entitled to a second opinion from someone else, though I did not get a first one.  
I feel the way I've been treated is an absolute disgrace. Totally disgusting.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Very bad reception
body: Arrived with my 4 and 7 year old as they had high temperature for days and had not eaten anything in say. The nurse at the front when I just arrived said that they are not taking any more patients. I arrived at 7 so I told the lady at the front that they close at 9pm and it is 7pm so why are they not taking an patients as it is still opening times, also I had two very ill young children. She still insist that they are not taking any more patient. She was very rude and inconsiderate, but I had to take my children to barnet hospital for a 6 hour wait, by that time my children's heart rates was racing and temperature was even higher. They needed urgen care amd medication. This was very awful to refuse young ill patients who arrived byway before the closing time, the lady at the front when we arrived at the walk in area was extremely heartless am should not be greeting sick patients at the front of the walk in centre.

author: HappyHighlander
title: Conquest hospital A&E
body:
I felt afraid because a patient with mental health crisis was not looked after quickly enough. They waited for about 4 hours (like me) in A&E reception, and then went and was destructive outside. The police came later. A nurse I asked if it was ok now said they have run away because they know they have been naughty. I'd say they were a vulnerable person who no one appeared to give a stuff about. Their care worker nattered on their mobile phone about their clients mental health in earshot of me and others in the waiting area, the care worker ignored their client, didn't sit with them or interact with them.  
The medical staff were nowhere to be seen - no one focussed on this patient. I believe the person was bored: I could see this from my work with asn kids, I could see where this was going, but medical triage did not prioritise them, and in the end they could not cope with waiting in an inappropriate, uncomfortable area for someone in mental health crisis. This ended up with me feeling unsafe, and a lot of damage outside.

title: Fantastic provider
body:
I finally had enough of my old surgery, a local provider well known for their terrible services, so I have moved to Crest Family Practice. 
I cried from happiness when it turned out I will have my own GP and that my GP wants me to come in to meet face 2 face. 

A real shock as I couldn't even remember when was the last time I had a face to face appointment with a clinical professional. At my old surgery, it was a battle to get booked even for a telephone appointment. 

It's such an incredible feeling when you call your surgery and get to speak with a receptionist within a second, and not being placed on hold and 40th in the queue, just to get disconnected after an hour on the phone and having to call again. And if you eventually get through to someone, the next available appointment will be some two weeks ahead. A telephone one, of course! Even if you are calling because of skin problems. 

I am just so happy to be treated so well and to see staff being treated well and not having to deal with complete chaos like in other surgeries in the area.

title: Brilliant Service.
body: From my first telephone appointment to diagnosis & beyond I was treated with compassion, understanding and reassurance. It’s a daunting experience but every step of the way I felt cared for. A mental health nurse checks in with me every so often but I know if I’m ever in need or crisis they’d be there for me. The phone is answered every time and is followed up swiftly if needed. They have my best interests at heart and I trust them with my care not just because it’s their job but because I’m treated with dignity and respect and not just a nhs number. Thank you.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst place with extremely rude staff
body: By far the worst practice I have ever had to deal with. Receptionists are so rude and always unwilling to help. I use to dread calling and it’s always a ridiculous wait to be seen even with an appointment booked - understandably there’s some wait but most times it would be almost an hour and when asking at reception it was as though I was the one in the wrong for asking. I have now moved! Best decision ever!!

author: cafecw54
title: Disconnected care
body: There have been three drug errors in the two years I have been under Dumfries cardiology, I see different consultant's almost as frequently as the season's change with no continuity between them. There is no follow up of test results or decisions to refer for treatment. When I complained, the reply is still outstanding. When I asked for my care to be transferred I was promised a call from the managers. The following day, still waiting. I dont believe anyone cares that I have been harmed by the mistakes, I dont believe anyone cares to treat me as an individual and to do as they say. Where are the management?

title: Worse practice
body: I have been at this gp for years now and the gp gets worse and worse as the years ago by. I had a miscarriage on the 7th July 2022 and the way they handled it was absolutely terrible. I kept ringing and ringing to get help as this was my first pregnancy and all the told me to do is ring back a couple days later if the pain and bleeding doesn’t stop. I rang a couple days after and some days they didn’t answer or somedays they told me that they’re not taking any more appointments. Never felt so mistreated! In the end I had to go a&e as the pain got worse and still had no help from this gp!

title: Lack of contact
body: I submitted an e-consult and was told I would have an answer within 5 days but I had no contact. I had to submit again before receiving a very short email in reply. I felt like an inconvenience, not a patient.

title: Good practice
body: I was unwell did an econsult and told I would be called in 3 days. I was ok with this but then got worse so I phoned and got a call back within 2 hours. I got worse the next day and had another urgent call back and was then seen to be assessed. Fortunately I did not need to be admitted to hospital but prescriptions were given to manage the symtpoms as well as advice on what to do if it got any worse or if it wasn't improving after the weekend. Thank you.

title: Don't bother registering here
body:
I am completely shocked by how ill equipped this clinic is to deal with its patient load. Not sure if it's a NHS funding issue or terrible management but something isn't working. For the third time in 2 weeks I can't even get into the 8am phone queue to try book an emergency appointment today. Despite calling every 5-30 seconds for 15 mins, all I get is the busy tone. When I raised this with the receptionist last week I was told they have no idea why that's happening, rather than they'll look into it.

When you do finally get onto a receptionist, you get to learn the earliest appointment is in 6 weeks and you don't get any time allocation, you just have to keep a whole day free for a doctor's call. Great for those with full time work. Furthermore, I was advised you can only discuss one health issue with your doctor per appointment, which would make sense if you can get appointments easily but borders on absurd given you have to wait 6 weeks and they'll only book one appointment at a time. As someone with multiple chronic health problems that require active management to avoid long stints of work/hospital admissions, it is a complete failure of patient care.

Finally, when you go into the clinic the receptionists leave you waiting for at least 5 minutes without ever acknowledging your presence. It looks like they're quite busy but would be nice for someone to say they'll be with you when they can, especially when you're waiting as they talk amongst themselves.

Honestly I would keep looking for another health clinic rather than registering here. When I initially saw reviews I thought "I'll be proactive, how bad can it be". Well the answer is, pretty bad!!

author: Russell30
title: Birth experience with two excellent midwives
body:
Special recognition to my amazing midwives.  
In the early hours of the day, I went into spontaneous labour with my 3rd baby girl.  
My previous labours were both inductions at 40+ weeks so this felt like a totally new thing for me.  
When I was transferred to the delivery suite, I was introduced to Chloe and Kirsteen. Chloe was there most of the time and was such a breath of fresh air. She knew when to chat and when I needed a bit of quiet. She was so friendly and nothing was a hassle for her.  
Chloe explained everything she was doing, even though she knew I had done it before.  
I felt in very good hands, even better after finding out she had not long qualified and was trained with my community midwife team.  
Chloe made me aware of my pain relief options, showed me how to use the gas and air properly and waited until I asked for morphine. We had to call her back in the room, along with Kirsteen, as baby didn't want to wait for morphine.  
I delivered with lots of positive encouragement from both ladies, reassuring me the whole way through.  
I agreed to let Chloe do my stitches, having not done many before. I made both ladies aware of the pain I experienced with stitches previously and they made sure I couldn't feel it this time. The whole time, they were talking and laughing with me, talking to dad and commenting on noises that our little baby was making.  
Chloe also supported me with breastfeeding for the first time. She didn't assume that I knew what or how to do it as I had other children. She was extremely patient and explained everything, making sure I understood each step. She then left us to feed and bond with our baby, with instructions to call her for anything at all - she even popped in several times after the birth to offer food and drinks to myself and my partner.  
I really couldn't have asked for a more supportive or friendly pair of midwives. For Chloe to be so new to this, but so good, tells me she is already and will continue to be an excellent midwife.  
Thank you so much for everything. My baby and I went home that night and she has settled in really well with her big sisters 🥰

author: thomh064
title: Fantastic care
body:
I attended Dr Dorman (Finaghy Health Centre, Belfast) with my elderly mother. Dr Dorman showed my mother care & compassion & answered all our questions in a reassuring manner. He listened attentively to all our concerns & we appreciate all the time he took.  
My mother became acutely unwell, & Dr Dorman along with Dr Connolly got my mother admitted to hospital. We will be forever grateful for their prompt response.  
I must also pay credit to the reception staff, who have helped me get my mum’s prescriptions & appointments arranged in a timely manner.  
Thanks again to a wonderful team

title: Short telephone wait
body: At 8am this morning I was caller No.34, by 8.20am my call was answered and telephone appointment booked, well done for the quick response time

title: Doors don’t open until 08.30
body:
I don’t have to ever use NHS services but when I’ve come to the hospital today to use minor injuries, I’ve had to wait outside in the cold until patients are “allowed” in at 08.30. I’ve been told this is due to hospital policy - I’m unsure why the policy changed, you use to be able to get in from 08.00 and you can see where they have changed the time in pen on the sign. 

I am young and fit but felt sorry for the elderly people waiting outside - why and who came up with this policy? Completely ridiculous

author: Mry22
title: Friendly and upbeat staff
body: I spent today on hollybank ward, cannock hospital having surgery on my arm. Every member of staff from the surgeon and his team to everyone working on the ward were amazing - efficient, professional, helpful, friendly and so upbeat. Apart from the circumstances I actually enjoyed the day 😄

author: sculptorrc98
title: Maternity care and Induction
body:
I gave birth in October and the maternity care we received throughout the pregnancy and birth was amazing. The maternity team in Oban hospital were all brilliant. Kirsty was our main midwife and her help, advice and support she gave us was so appreciated and she was so friendly and made us feel super comfortable and relaxed the entire process. The rest of the team that we dealt with were also all so lovely and knowledgeable. (Rosie, Eva, Sheila, Hannah)  
I ended up with cholestatis of pregnancy, and spoke to Rosie initially via phone when I had the symptoms. Rosie was super reassuring and Hannah came out straight away to take bloods to be tested, and when the diagnosis came back, Rosie and Kirsty both spoke me through the condition and made me feel really at ease. When it came to the fact I needed an induction, Kirsty was with me the entire way even though I'd be down in RAH in Paisley for the birth. She explained the entire induction process and was available on the phone & via text when I had any questions and with advice.  
The induction at RAH went really well. All the midwives were really attentive and made us feel really at ease. This was something I was worried about - not knowing any of the midwives for the induction & birth but I didn't need to worry as they all made me feel comfortable. We felt for the midwives in RAH as they were extremely busy with the amount of us on the ward to the amount of staff on at any one time. Despite this, I felt they were still very attentive and were all working really hard the entire time.  
We were also really impressed with the aftercare, the Oban midwife team were really helpful and supportive after babies arrival, and I felt the home visits were really useful as we had mountains of questions as first time parents and these were all answered in great detail by Kirsty, Sheila and Eva. We also had a bit of worry as he dropped slightly more weight than he should have but we were given so much support and help with this and he soon put the weight back on.  
Overall a huge thanks to the teams in Oban and RAH.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: Anap
title: The procedure ran very smoothly
body:
I just want to express my thanks to all the staff who cared for me when in having a gastroscopy. The whole procedure from admission to discharge ran very smoothly! All staff greated me with a smilling face and treated me with true compassion and professionalism. My patient journey from entering the door until leaving was a very pleasant experience.  
The staff in the day admissions are an absolute credit to your trust!  
Many thanks

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: librang66
title: An emergency appointment
body:
My GP's phoned me to see how I was. Told I was still feeling numbness in my right arm. He sent me to A/E/Neurology at the QE Birmingham. I reached there in the late afternoon and after an hour or so I eventually saw a doctor who tested me and said they were going to talk to the consultants.  
I eventually saw them around six hours later. They gave me a painkiller discharged me telling me that they would send the prescription to the GP and I would be seeing a spinal surgeon. That was a number of days ago.  
My GP hasn't received the prescription and the discharge letter and when I've tried to call the department the contact centre hasn't heard of the dept. So I still have no use of my arm and no painkillers and I'll be damned if I go back.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care has been asbolutely great
body: The care that I have been getting in the hospital has been absolutely grand so far really happy enough with the care. The nurses that I have been talking to are all absolutely great. Like every single one of them that i have spoke to have been lovely with absolutely anything that I need from they go above and beyond with. The doctors I don’t see much I see bone a bit called Dr Stinson and his lovely does a great job explaining things so I understand. The foods been very decent really cannot complain and have had no issues with anything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff all speak so clearly
body: The care in my opinion has been absolutely been perfect so far and despite only being in I have been so impressed with the care that I have been getting. The staff have been absolutely fantastic towards me always so kind and friendly like there isn’t anything bad that I could say about them they have been exceptional. I understand them all fine as they all speak so clearly. The foods also pretty deadon like it’s not bad. I Have had absolutely no issues with the care that I have got as I am very happy with it

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Waiting times quick
body: The care here has been absolutely deadon so far don’t really think that I can have any complaints about the care that I have been getting so far. The staff have all been lovely all introduced themselves and were very polite. Happy enough with them. I understand them all fine no issues with communication. The waiting time was also pretty quick like cant really complain I have had no issues and am honestly happy enough with the care I have been getting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Trebor Dier
title: Cataract operation
body: I had a much needed Cataract Operation in Dec 2022. I would like to say how excellent Mr Lewis & all the fantastic staff involved, were. The attention, care, thoughtfulness and professionalism was second to none. And now with my operation, my standard of life has and will just get better and better! Again, thank you to all for first class patient care.

author: JanieTwins
title: Severe vertigo
body:
In June 2022 my GP referred me to Forth Valley Hospital, Critical care dept. with suspected vertigo. After tests the consultant referred me to Physiotherapy and was told that the crystals in my ear had moved. They gave me some BPPV self treatment exercises which helped but did not remove the problem permanently.  
They also referred me to Jean at the Physio Gym at Falkirk Community Hospital. She started me on Vestibular rehabilitation exercises and lots of good advice on handling the problem. After five appointments my vertigo was completely under control my confidence has returned allowing me to go out alone. This is to thank Jean so very much and without this help at the Physio gym at Falkirk Community Hospital I would be still struggling with this condition. Thank you

author: leatherng43
title: First class service
body: I got scrabed by my kitten my wrist was swollen  . I went to the above hospital seen within  2 hours given antibiotics  and tetanus injection . Absolutely first class service .

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female surgical staff are outstanding
body:
Female surgical has been fine, it has been a good place so far. The ward itself is clean and neat, everyone has their own spot so nothing gets mixed up. I do not mind everyone being mixed, everyone talks away which passes the day a bit quicker. The food is okay, however I like he variety of it all since I won’t eat the same thing all the time.  
The staff here are so pleasant. Every single staff member is very approachable and friendly. I feel like I could tell them anything and they would not judge you. The care assistants are the very best people and only want what is good for you.  
Female surgical staff are outstanding.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Neeber
title: They made me feel really relaxed
body: Today I had an Endoscopy carried out at Kirkcaldy hospital. I was Met by shona who took all my details and was really nice. Then waited about 20 mins then was taken to the endoscopy room where I met Mr Naqvi, Pelyn and Lynn. They made me feel really relaxed and the care during the operation was 1st class. Can’t thank them enough.

author: phoenixcw78
title: Very impressed with care during Carpal Tunnel Operation
body:
I had Carpal Tunnel Surgery yesterday. I arrived half an hour early but they took me straight through so I didn't need to wait around at all which was good.  
I was very impressed with the whole team and process. It was all a very smooth and efficient process. Everything was lovely and calm, and everyone was speaking to one another. The place was very clean.  
All of the staff at every point in the process were so reassuring and keen to help with any worries by always been happy to answer questions and explain everything really clearly. The physio saw me after the op and gave me a helpful leaflet with information on about exercises. Having to go back again to have the dressings sorted was also clearly explained to me.  
I attended the surgical unit and Doctor Robinson did the surgery. After the surgery the staff explained to me that there had been no complications and I had a coffee and two sandwiches.  
I felt very comfortable the whole time. The staff were all very willing to answer every query I had. Everything was great and I was checked regularly to make sure I was okay.

author: A very greatful daughter
title: My mother's recent stay in ward 7
body: My mother had a stay in ward 7. At times she was a bit confused.All the staff were fantastic from doctors nurses domestic and porters. They were all so nice The nursing staff were so patient with her and were great at keeping myself and family up to date with results of all the tests she had. The ward itself was very clean and bright.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: DougS
title: Old age & dementia support
body: After being diagnosed with dementia the community mental health support team led by Janie and her colleagues provided regular care to my mother .

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female surgical has been a top class experience
body:
Female surgical has been okay. The ward itself is quite calm which I am glad of so I can relax and recover in peace. I am also glad of the dark evenings and morning as it makes it easier to sleep. The other patients on the ward are very nice and talkative. The ward temperature is fine and usually I am quite a cold person, especially since they often come around offering tea which helps keep me warm also.  
The staff are lovely, they tell me everything that it going on medically and the care they are treating me with is unbelievable. Some of the staff are sharp but majority are very kind.  
Female surgical has been a top class experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
